trustfund: TF022213-CANADIAN GENERAL CTF II-EGYPT,TF029507-PHRD-SOHAG RURAL DEV. PROJ.(BANK-EXECUTED),TF029555-PHRD-SOHAG RURAL DEV.PROJ.(RECIPIENT-EXEC.)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sohag Rural Development
            Project (SRDP) for Egypt were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: the decentralized model used
            by the project proved to be highly suitable and replicable,
            and it was a pioneering project in many aspects in a
            difficult and socially conservative setting. In future
            projects it will be important to work out at the outset the
            project details of how to ensure its sustainability (i.e.
            appointment of counterparts, provision of incentives, etc.).
            In addition, and as a result of the SRDP implementation,
            Sohag Governorate has been able to lobby more effectively
            for development budget from central Government over the past
            two years since the project and its extensive services
            sectors and districts has provided theme with a good
            understanding of their overall needs. Project interventions
            need to be designed as an integrated package of
            infrastructure, credit and training. There was a consensus
            that basic infrastructure is needed to provide public
            services as well as new job opportunities. Community-based
            micro credit channeled through Banks and Non-Governmental
            Organizations (NGOs) should be increased and loan requests
            processed in Sohag, rather than Cairo.
